page.title: 02 Burnhope Mast
page.content: {Burnhope Mast The mast is 750ft tall.It has 15 lights there are three sets of lights every 150ft.At the base of the mast there are fields and gorse bushes- before there were polo fields for coal mine owners .The mast stands at the east side of the village over looking Browney valley and Lanchester.It was erected 1958 and was erected to transmit black and white television programmes.It transmitted to all over the North East of England from Alnwick to the far South of Scarborough. The mast stopped transmitting T.V programmes on January 3rd 1985.The last programme was News at One.The mast now transmits Metro radio (Newcastle.)Maintenance men paint the mast every five years and grease the stays regularly to stop them rusting.
